title: Update beads skill and agent with PR workflow documentation
description:
Add the standard PR workflow to the beads skill and agent documentation:

## Workflow to Document

### Session Start
- git checkout main && git pull (start fresh)
- bd ready (find available tasks)
- bd show <id> (read task requirements)

### Task Execution
- git checkout -b feature/<name> (create feature branch)
- bd update <id> --status in_progress (claim task)
- Do the work: read code, implement with TDD, run quality gates
- bd close <id> --reason "description" --suggest-next (complete task)
- git add <files> && git commit -m "type(scope): description"

### PR Creation
- git push -u origin <branch>
- gh pr create --title "type(scope): description" --body "- Change one\n- Change two"
- Notify user with PR URL

### Wait for Merge
- User reviews, CI runs, user merges
- Check status: gh pr view --json state -q '.state' (returns MERGED when done)

### Cleanup & Continue
- git checkout main && git pull && git branch -d <branch>
- bd ready (find next task)
- Repeat

## Key Principles
1. One task = one branch = one PR
2. Claim before working: bd update --status in_progress
3. Close with reason: Documents what was done
4. Minimal PRs: Title + bullets only
5. Wait for user: Never auto-merge or assume approval
6. Clean up: Delete local branch after merge

## Files to Update
- core/skills/beads/SKILL.md
- core/agents/beads-worker/AGENT.md (or similar)

Create typescript language plugin with multiple focused skills
description:
## Task
Create a new TypeScript language plugin following the Elixir multi-skill pattern with four focused skills.

## Skills to Load
- /claude-code:claude-plugins - Plugin.json schema and validation
- /claude-code:claude-skills - Skill creation with progressive disclosure
- /claude-code:claude-agents - Agent creation (if needed for TS tooling)

## Structure
```
typescript/
├── .claude-plugin/
│   └── plugin.json        # version 0.1.0, category: language
└── skills/
    ├── sources.md         # Master sources for all TS skills
    ├── language/
    │   └── SKILL.md       # Core TS: types, generics, utility types, strict mode
    ├── testing/
    │   └── SKILL.md       # Testing: vitest, jest, playwright, strict assertions
    ├── linting/
    │   └── SKILL.md       # Linting: eslint, biome, strict configs, rules
    └── node/
        └── SKILL.md       # Node.js/runtime: async, streams, modules, npm/pnpm
```

## Skill Coverage

### language (typescript-language)
- TypeScript strict mode (strict: true, all strict flags)
- Type system: generics, conditional types, mapped types, template literals
- Utility types: Partial, Required, Pick, Omit, Record, etc.
- Declaration files and type-only imports
- Enums, discriminated unions, exhaustive checking
- tsconfig.json best practices (strict linting focus)

### testing (typescript-testing)
- Vitest and Jest: setup, mocking, assertions
- Type-level testing (expect-type, tsd)
- Playwright for E2E testing
- Test coverage and CI integration
- mise task definitions for test workflows

### linting (typescript-linting)
- ESLint with typescript-eslint: strict configs
- Biome as alternative linter/formatter
- Strict rule recommendations (no-any, strict-boolean-expressions, etc.)
- Prettier/formatting integration
- Pre-commit hooks and CI lint checks
- mise tasks for lint workflows

### node (typescript-node)
- Node.js runtime patterns: async/await, streams, EventEmitter
- Module systems: ESM vs CJS, package.json exports
- Package managers: npm, pnpm, bun
- mise integration for Node.js version management
- CI/CD patterns for Node.js projects

## Registration
1. Create typescript/.claude-plugin/plugin.json (version 0.1.0)
2. Add entry to .claude-plugin/marketplace.json (category: language, version: 0.1.0)
3. Add all 4 skill paths to all-skills plugin.json
4. Bump all-skills version
5. Update skill-catalog.md with typescript keyword triggers
6. Run mise update-all-skills and mise test to validate

## Verification
- mise test:plugin typescript passes
- mise test:marketplace passes
- mise test passes (all plugins valid)
- All 4 SKILL.md files have valid frontmatter
- plugin.json and marketplace.json versions match
- Each skill has clear activation criteria in description

title: Create slidev presentation tool plugin with comprehensive skill
description:
## Task
Create a new Slidev (sli.dev) plugin as a single comprehensive skill following the Rust single-skill pattern. Slidev is a markdown-based presentation framework for developers built on Vite + Vue 3.

## Skills to Load
- /claude-code:claude-plugins - Plugin.json schema and validation
- /claude-code:claude-skills - Skill creation with progressive disclosure
- /claude-code:claude-agents - Agent creation (if needed for Slidev tooling)

## Structure
```
slidev/
├── .claude-plugin/
│   └── plugin.json        # version 0.1.0, category: tools
└── skills/
    ├── SKILL.md           # Comprehensive Slidev skill
    └── sources.md         # Source attribution (sli.dev docs)
```

## SKILL.md Coverage (Focus Areas)

### Slide Authoring
- Markdown slide syntax: --- separators, frontmatter per slide, headmatter
- Layouts: center, cover, two-cols, image-right, section, statement, fact, quote, etc.
- Presenter notes: comment blocks at slide end
- Importing slides from external markdown files
- Frontmatter merging and configuration inheritance
- MDC syntax for inline styling

### Code Blocks & Interactive Features
- Shiki syntax highlighting with line highlighting ({1,3-5})
- Line numbers, max height, code groups (tabbed)
- Monaco Editor integration: interactive editing and execution
- Shiki Magic Move: animated code transitions between slides
- TwoSlash integration for TypeScript type annotations
- Import code snippets from external files (<<< @/path/to/file.ts)

### Animations & Clicks
- Click markers: v-click, v-after, v-click-hide directives
- Click animations with at prop for ordering
- Motion animations with @slidev/addon-animotion or CSS
- Slide transitions: fade, slide-left, slide-up

### Themes & Styling
- Theme installation: npm i @slidev/theme-<name>
- UnoCSS utility-first styling (built-in)
- Scoped CSS per slide via <style scoped>
- Custom theme creation and configuration
- Font configuration in headmatter

### Components & Vue Integration
- Built-in components: Arrow, AutoFitText, LightOrDark, Link, RenderWhen, Toc
- Custom Vue components in /components/ directory
- Slot sugar syntax for layout customization
- Global layers (top/bottom) for persistent elements

### Diagrams & Math
- Mermaid diagrams: flowcharts, sequence, gantt, etc.
- PlantUML diagrams
- LaTeX/KaTeX for mathematical notation

### CLI Commands
- slidev [entry] - Start dev server (default: slides.md)
- slidev export - Export to PDF/PPTX/PNG/MD
- slidev build - Build static SPA for hosting
- slidev format - Format slide markdown files
- slidev theme - Theme management

### Exporting & Deployment
- PDF export via playwright-chromium
- PPTX export (image-based with presenter notes)
- PNG per-slide export
- Static SPA build for web hosting (Netlify, Vercel, GitHub Pages)
- Key flags: --with-clicks, --dark, --range, --with-toc, --timeout
- exportFilename headmatter option

### Project Structure
- slides.md - Main presentation file
- components/ - Custom Vue components
- layouts/ - Custom layout components
- public/ - Static assets (images, files)
- styles/ - Global style customizations
- package.json - Dependencies and scripts
- mise integration for slidev CLI and Node.js management

### Best Practices
- One concept per slide for clarity
- Use layouts to structure content visually
- Leverage code highlighting for technical talks
- Use presenter notes for speaking cues
- Export with --with-clicks for step-by-step animations in PDF
- Keep slides.md as single source of truth
- Use code groups for multi-language comparisons
- Test exports before presenting (playwright-chromium dependency)

## Key References
- https://sli.dev/ - Official documentation
- https://sli.dev/guide/syntax - Slide syntax reference
- https://sli.dev/guide/exporting - Export guide
- https://sli.dev/themes/gallery - Theme gallery
- https://sli.dev/resources/showcases - Community examples

## Registration
1. Create slidev/.claude-plugin/plugin.json (version 0.1.0)
2. Add entry to .claude-plugin/marketplace.json (category: tools, version: 0.1.0)
3. Add ./slidev/skills to all-skills plugin.json
4. Bump all-skills version
5. Update skill-catalog.md with slidev keyword triggers (slidev, sli.dev, presentation, slides, deck)
6. Run mise update-all-skills and mise test to validate

## Verification
- mise test:plugin slidev passes
- mise test:marketplace passes
- mise test passes (all plugins valid)
- SKILL.md frontmatter has name and description
- plugin.json and marketplace.json versions match
- Skill activates for presentation/slide-related tasks

description:
Move bd close from Task Execution phase to after CI passes. Current workflow closes tasks before CI validation, risking marking tasks complete when CI might fail.

Changes:
- CLAUDE.md: Add Watch CI step, move beads closure after CI passes
- core/skills/git/SKILL.md: Same PR workflow update  
- core/skills/beads/SKILL.md: New 'Watch CI & Close Tasks' section
- Version bump core plugin 0.1.7 → 0.1.8
